intro: Tabernaemontana membranacea, commonly known as the membranaceus tabernacle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces fleshy,蓇葖 fruits that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its elegant appearance and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
